results.title: Guam: gateway to Micronesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
Guam lies in the western reaches of the Pacific ocean. With its green rolling hills, soft trade winds, gleaming whilte sands, coral reefs and tranquil lagoons, Guam offers the idyllic escape.

Tibet: the roof of the world

results.title: Bahrain: The pearl of the Arabian Gulf
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
Bahrain, an island nation in the Arabian Gulf, was once the capital of the pearl trade and was the site of the first oil discovery in the Gulf States. This includes an interview with the Amir of the State of Bahrain.

Tibet: the roof of the world

results.title: Tibet: the roof of the world
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
For many years, Tibet was a land shrouded in mystery, shadowed by the mighty Himalayas and closed to western travellers. This travelogue takes the viewer into the heart of Tibet and its people. From the wonderous Potola, once home to the Tibetan spirtual leader, the Dalai Lama, to the mountain herders and their yaks, to carpet factories where weavers work for months on elaborate designs, this is an incredible journey through a rugged landscape. The intensly spiritual nature of Tibetans and the incredibly beautiful monastaries and elaborate rituals which celebrate their faith are testimony to the country’s strong commitment to Buddhist principles.

results.title: A Child's place
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones, Dick Foster and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
Looks at the system of daycare for young children in Israel, USSR, China and Sweden.The film asks “Where are the children? Who are they with? and what are they doing?”.

results.title: Part time parent, full time job
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones, Dick Foster and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Parents and Children”.
Society expects parents to be both workers and up-bringers. Two societies have made conscious attempts to resolve the conflict between the world of work and the family - Sweden and the Israeli Kibbutz.

results.title: Mummy, daddy Lenin and Mao
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones, Dick Foster and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Urie Bronfenbrenner considers the changes that are taking place in the traditional roles of men and women both in the family and in the world at large.

results.title: Goals for the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Considers such topics as family breakdown, violence and vandalism, and alienation in youth.
